title.rendered: Shami replaces Bumrah In India’s ICC Men’s T20 World Cup 2022 squad

content.rendered:
The All-India Senior Selection Committee on Friday announced fast bowler Mohammad Shami as Jasprit Bumrah’s replacement in India’s ICC men’s T20 World Cup 2022 squad. Shami who was already named in the squad as a standby player has already reached Australia to join Rohit Sharma & Co. The 32-year-old will link up with the Indian squad in Brisbane ahead of the warm-up matches.

The BCCI informed on Twitter while writing, Mohammad Siraj and Shardul Thakur have been named as backups and will travel to Australia shortly.

The BCCI

Read also:No India- Pakistan bilateral cricket series till 2027
